summary: An FBI 302 report documenting a phone call on January 8, 2020, with a mother who was contacted to schedule an interview. She states she did not know Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell well, visited Epstein's home once with her daughter, and that Epstein and Maxwell later proposed moving to New York with her and her daughter, which she refused. She describes Maxwell as 'evil' and blames them for destroying her life, indicating her daughter was a victim.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased financier and convicted sex offender. The mother states she did not know him well, visited his home once, and that he and Maxwell proposed moving to New York with her and her daughter.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Epstein's associate, convicted for her role in his sex trafficking scheme. The mother describes her as 'evil, evil as can be' and worse than Epstein because she appealed to her as a mother.

connections.description: Described together as 'evil' by the mother, who states they lied to her, wanted to help with art, and proposed a move to New York.
Presented as a pair who 'loved art' and made joint proposals to the mother. The mother perceives Maxwell as the worse of the two.

events.title: FBI Phone Contact with Mother
events.description: An FBI agent contacted a mother by phone to schedule an in-person interview. During the call, she provided preliminary information about her limited interactions with Epstein and Maxwell and the impact on her daughter.

events.title: Visit to Epstein's Home
events.description: The mother and her daughter visited Jeffrey Epstein's home on one occasion.

events.title: Proposal to Move to New York
events.description: Epstein and Maxwell told the mother they wanted to move to New York with her and her daughter. She refused.

locations: New York, New York, United States
keyFacts: A mother contacted by the FBI stated she and her daughter visited Jeffrey Epstein's home on one occasion.
Epstein and Maxwell later proposed moving to New York with the mother and her daughter, which she refused.
The mother described Ghislaine Maxwell as 'evil, evil as can be' and felt Maxwell was worse than Epstein because she appealed to her as a mother.
The mother blamed Epstein and Maxwell for destroying her life, indicating her daughter was a victim of their actions.
The document is an FBI 302 form documenting a preliminary contact, noting the mother's willingness to meet for a full interview.
